storyInfo: In 1090, after making meticulous preparations, Kal'tsit and Theresa finally awaken the Doctor, who for the first time makes direct contact with the civilizations of Terra.

attributes.content: I prepared a gift for you, {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: What do you hear?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: This is...
Do you remember? This is the polarization formed when AMa-10 was born. You said you found a rhythm within its waveform. Of course, I added a little personal touch.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I adjusted the direction of the planetary track's array to capture different echoes. The harmony is derived from the lingering neutrinos of extinguishing stars. As for the orchestrator, I used the gravitational folds left behind when the ship sailed through the stargate.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Oh... I knew you'd like it, {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The universe's singing... Even at this moment, it's still as touching as ever.
But this violates the norms we set ourselves, Priestess. These facilities should've kept operating on the preset path.
The stars are losing their color. This world no longer has norms, doesn't it?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: This place will fall silent soon, almost like we've never been here.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Come walk with me, before the silence comes.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I hope... we'll get to see this world's future with our own eyes together, {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.text: 'We will... I will wait for you in that world.'

attributes.content: Rhodes Island of Babel, Kazdel
Phew! Finally done retrofitting the electrical wiring. Now we're gonna be able to withstand any impact... I think.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: How dare Kal'tsit make me work forty-eight hours nonstop... Once all this is over, I'm gonna tell Her Highness on her!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Confirmed within the landship's communications range. Signal's clear. The mini bases you hid around are great, Closure.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Of course! Not even Her Highness has seen anything this handy!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Is their so-called research finished?
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: The energy surge caused by the last couple rounds almost got Rhodes Island to stall. I'm still reinforcing the landship for the next impact.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: You know how much I racked my brains to cover up the landship's movement? Like, what if the Military Commission's spies caught wind—
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Relax. I've already eliminated all our targets nearby. Just focus on your preparations.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Scout, report.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: The infiltration mission is complete. I'm sending the intel back to Babel.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: What's the situation inside the city?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Not much has changed over the past few years. Not many Catastrophes. Very little movement.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Our situation's not very optimistic, actually. If the Military Commission continues to shrink our strategic space—
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Let's trust Her Highness and Dr. Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: You're right... They've spent so much time preparing for today's experiment just to turn the tide.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Right, Scout, have you gotten your hands on the equipment I was keeping at my place?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I've already entrusted it to a Messenger to take to Babel.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Awesome. With the secret weapon Kal'tsit and I knocked out together, we'll definitely crack that weird control system on the ship.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I'll rendezvous with the Messenger and confirm the package's risk level before bringing it to the landship.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: We have been investigating the agent behind our missing engineer too. The threat against the landship hasn't been fully eliminated yet.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Closure, I brought you even more materials, just as you asked. They're so heavy!
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Thanks, Odda! Hm... Looks like now I can make more safety equipment for Her Highness and Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: And I should install an extra line for backup. Hope there won't be any unexpected surprises this time...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Do you need any help, Closure?
attributes.name: Odda

attributes.content: Oh. You should hurry and evacuate to a safe zone with everybody else. The next wave of impacts... is probably gonna be in thirty minutes.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Now everything's all ready.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Hm... I'm kinda curious... Just what kind of secret experiments are Kal'tsit and Her Highness running? They even need to mod the energy and defense modules, not to mention those weird tests...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: There is no one with a better understanding of Originium.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If you want to solve the suffering caused by Originium...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: There is no better candidate for the job.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The news you bring is always so... surprising. Even for the King of Sarkaz...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Are those devices really still working...? Are you confident about the resurrection?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The vast majority of lifeforms on Terra can't resist corrosion that spans such a long stretch of time.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Terra we see today is no doubt a miracle, and so are you, Theresa.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But in the past, the whole solar system revolving around the sun was insignificant in their eyes.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You seem a little tense... and also a little anxious and nervous.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Is there anything else that worries you?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...Yes.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But... I can't tell you.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It's okay! Sorry, I shouldn't have distracted you. Focus. I can feel it.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: 'Kal'tsit...' You love this name, don't you?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I... I've forgotten almost everything else about those days.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But I still remember how, in that distant, distant past, somebody gave me this name—
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: 'Kal'tsit.'
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: That was the last time we ever met.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.text: 'Kal'tsit. I do not have much time left.
'Search for traces of life. Search for hope and a future.

attributes.content: Then why hesitate?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I know what you mean. It's just...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...I've had a premonition... worry... or perhaps, a conjecture.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: At the starting point of this land, at a certain point in time when life had only started budding, something that can never be reversed happened here.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And I don't know what it is.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If it's someone that even Dr. Kal'tsit can put her full faith in, then I'm not one bit worried.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Besides, considering how cautious you are, the safety measures that you prepared well ahead of time have never allowed me to worry.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I'm sorry to say this, Theresa.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: This alone, no matter how many contingency measures I prepare, I still can't confidently say anything is conclusive.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Theresa, I can't guarantee that I will always make the most rational decision.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And this time... I want to believe.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Then do what you want to. I'll be here, with you.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Kal'tsit's hand touches the door that has stood silently still for a cryptically long stretch of time.
A new wave of tremors reaches Rhodes Island.
The door loosens.

attributes.text: 'Originium will become the beacon, condensed by our civilization...
'If one day, other lifeforms in the universe lose their homeland and seek a way to resolve their plight,
'We once delivered a gift to those who came after us, before our annihilation—

attributes.content: (Unknown language) This place...
(Unknown language) Is... it... time already?
Warning: Unknown power activated.
Warning: PRTS access detected...
Warning: PRTS access detect—
PRTS access reset complete. Administrator permissions confirmed.
All communication module channels open. Communications receiver module overclocking procedure completed.
Search: Preserver... No signal.
Search: Caerula Arbor... No signal.
Search: Celestial Fulcrum... No signal.
Search: (Unknown static noise)... No signal.
Search complete. No signal detected on any channel.
Would you like to retry—
(Unknown language) No... answer...
(Unknown language) Just... me...
(Unknown language) How long... has it been?
Searching progress logs...
Latest update: Four million, seven hundred fifty-five thousand, nine hundred and fifty-four days ago.
Abnormal vital signs detected. Loading restoration module.
Restoring—
(Unknown language) Did I... wake up too early... or... too late?
(Unknown language) What stage... has Originium reached?
Searching Originium inspection history data... No response.
Originium inspection module is disconnected.
(Unknown language) 'Terra...'
(Unknown language) Why save... all these... redundant information...
(Unknown language) This... isn't recorded in the database... A new language?
(Unknown language) A new civilization... is born...?
(Unknown language) It's... just... me... What about her...? Priestess? My...
(Unknown language) I can answer your question. I saved those data in PRTS in advance.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Unknown language) You...?
A hint of unfamiliarity, perplexity, and... vigilance flashed in the eyes of the person stuck in the past.
Kal'tsit senses it from the glare of the person in the sarcophagus.
Likewise, Theresa senses Kal'tsit's nervousness.
(Unknown language) Wait...
(Unknown language) You've changed a fair bit...
The person inside the sarcophagus feels like they have just woken up from a short dream.
The lifeform that bid them farewell prior to sleep is still here by their side.
(Unknown language) ...but you've never left.
(Unknown language) No... From the moment I left this place until now, when I am standing here before you again—
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Unknown language) I have wandered for thousands of years.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Unknown language) However, I have never forgotten the question you left me—
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal'tsit waits uneasily. She needs to make sure...
She needs to make sure that her hope has not gone through some kind of horrible change.
(Unknown language) That... was not... a question. That was... what I looked forward to...
(Unknown language) Then... Have you found the meaning of your life yet?
(Unknown language) Discovering the meaning in the continuation of life... It's a path that I will have to keep walking.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Unknown language) You still remember...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Unknown language) I still remember... To me, it was like yesterday when we said goodbye to each other, but it also seemed like an eternity...
(Unknown language) But to you...
(Unknown language) There was never a moment when I forgot all you have done for me.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Aside from my life, you granted me one other thing that I found most precious—Freedom, Dr. {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Please... just Doctor will do, Kal'tsit.
(Unknown language) Let me... get out first...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: (Unknown language) You are still very weak. I can help—
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Unknown language) No need...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Kal'tsit, I still... have many questions.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: (Unknown language) What has become of Originium...? I couldn't find any records.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: (Unknown language) It still grows on the continent outside.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Unknown language) So I woke up too early.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: (Unknown language) You've suffered, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: (Unknown language) I can tell from your eyes. You woke me up because you need my help?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Yes, we need your help.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Unknown language) I see. That 'devil'?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: (Unknown language) I can see from your friend behind you that not only has Originium found an unexpected way to exist...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: (Unknown language) She also possesses... yes, Civilight Eterna.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: (Unknown language) The course of this civilization is... very complicated.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Unknown language) What's her name...? Does their civilization have anything like that used to refer to individuals?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Theresa.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The... re... sa...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: The awakened one walks up to Theresa and holds out two arms, showing the palms of those hands.
Theresa extends her hands to lightly hold the hands of the one from the past.
The Doctor feels warmth.
Yes, Theresa.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: This is the moment two civilizations make contact with one another, yet Theresa can see sadness in the eyes of this Doctor from eras long gone.
And she feels no warmth from the hands she is holding.
Originium... and you... together.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: You speak our language?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I... learned... from... records. Not... hard.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Unbelievable! I was thinking about learning your language. Kal'tsit said—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: My world... is lost. Languages of the past... should stay in the past.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I... am curious about your kind. You found... and even entered... Civilight Eterna.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I... want to... ask—
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Ask you everything about your... civilization.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: That's the only way... I can find traces of my world... the world of the past.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: ...I understand.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Hm, Doctor, Is that how you say it? Please forgive me. Keep holding my hands.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I will show you—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Doctor cannot help but be attracted to the eyes of this creature that looks like a devil.
Through her eyes, the one who lost a world sees—
Life.
Civilization is born from the instinct of living beings. It's survival of the fittest.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Natural selection. This is how the cycle of life is formed.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: (Feeble wailing)
attributes.name: Burdenbeast

attributes.content: A burdenbeast accidentally fell beneath the ice pushes a small cub up from the water with its head.
The small burdenbeast staggers on the ice and walks toward the hunters who are waiting afar with their bait.
It's coming this way. Get ready.
attributes.name: Kjerag Hunter

attributes.content: The hunter grabs the starving burdenbeast cub before the ice cracks underneath them.
Good. At least we managed to save one.
attributes.name: Kjerag Hunter

attributes.content: Rebellion. Going against our survival instinct is the catalyst of our civilization's evolution.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: And curiosity... curiosity is what we burn our lives away for, the staircase that allow our civilization to proceed forward.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: A pioneer chasing the stars is pushing forward with his fallen ally on his back.
*pant*... *pant*... You dipshit... Why can't you keep at it for just one more day?!
attributes.name: Weary Pioneer

attributes.content: The newspapers already said that it was the crashed aircraft of the Wrights, not a shooting star! But you just had to get to the bottom of it!
attributes.name: Weary Pioneer

attributes.content: They were failures who crashed from the sky! What was there to risk your life for?
attributes.name: Weary Pioneer

attributes.content: Those rocks that fell onto the land? What did you want to prove to me?
attributes.name: Weary Pioneer

attributes.content: I, too, once saw within the Black Crown the sun getting engulfed, with darkness shrouding the whole continent.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But even in its darkest hour, there were still those who tried to light up the night.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It's still black! The sun really is dead!
attributes.name: Curious Archosauria

attributes.content: *sigh*... The sun's been dead for too long... We gotta save it! If the sun doesn't live, how are we going to hold our tail thickness contests?
attributes.name: Courageous Archosauria

attributes.content: But how?
attributes.name: Curious Archosauria

attributes.content: We climb the tallest mountain, and raise a torch up high to light it back up.
attributes.name: Courageous Archosauria

attributes.content: What if our arms get tired?
attributes.name: Curious Archosauria

attributes.content: Hm... then we'll build a statue of me, and my statue will hold the torch up instead.
attributes.name: Courageous Archosauria

attributes.content: Good idea! We can build my statue next to yours to hold up another torch, too! Then, if your torch goes out, my torch can light yours!
attributes.name: Curious Archosauria

attributes.content: With fire comes light, and it is light that guides us toward hope.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: And my kin see death as a different interpretation of hope.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: After your body's destruction, to become one with the city within the Soul Furnace's flames is an honor bestowed only on those who are most respected.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: They will grow as Originium crystals and become one with Kazdel.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The newborn will grow among the fluttering dust, and continue their march forward with hardships in tow amid the chorus of the myriad souls.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Progress mixed with ignorance... The cycle continues and repeats over and over.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: So... beautiful.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: So... nostalgic.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Your kind... Terra seems to have gotten back on the right track... and achieving enlightenment.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: How is 'ignorance' defined, and how do we prove the progress of 'enlightenment?'
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The way I see it, all of this is part of our civilization.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But the things you showed me... Most of them are... extremely different compared to your race.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Conquerors and the conquered, both have been branded with inerasable marks by this land throughout the evolution of civilization...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: For the sake of survival, I believe that all discrepancies will be unified, and all clans will become one.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: In the future that I envision, all the many lands will become one.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: That's a stirring belief... It's admirable.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I can feel that... you truly love this great land.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Be it discrimination, war, or disaster... The object of your love has long surpassed an individual or a clan.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: But if you... surpass the extremes of the civilization you belong to... no one will be able to comprehend your love.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: On the contrary... they will loathe you.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Do you understand what you will have to go through... to reach the future you strive for?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: If there is no choice but to walk that path, I will gladly do so.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa. A Terran.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: No wonder Kal'tsit trusts you. She willingly took the risk to wake me in order to help you.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Right. When every era comes to an end, there are always those who try their hardest to change the tide in the final moments.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: But most of the time, their stories don't end well.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Nevertheless, there is no doubt that you have my admiration.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: After all, on a certain level, you are very similar to some people that I knew.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I will never get to see them again...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: ...Perhaps I'll need some more time to get my thoughts in order.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: But no matter. I think I should... listen to what you two have to say first.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: What do you need me to do?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Doctor, you need rest.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'm fine.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Kal'tsit. She's given me lots of surprises, but on top of that, she's given me even more challenges.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Sorry... I mean 'confusion'.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I still don't have a very good grasp of the Sarkaz language.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I saw a lot of unexpected things in her. Surely you did too.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I made enemies with her, came to know her, began to understand her wish, and finally admired her responsibility...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: That Black Crown shared with Theresa the long history and experience it bears, and she too slowly gained foresight that no other can attain.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I felt... perhaps this would be our best chance. With her, with Babel, and with Terra.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: 'With Terra.'
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: You, too, are part of 'this great land' now, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I hope you will take this journey with us, too.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Right...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I envy you, and I trust you, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: But I am just a researcher. Perhaps the help I can offer won't be as significant as you hoped.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Oripathy, Catastrophe... Disasters that we have no methods to resist have been bringing many hardships to these lands... yet Terra's technology is almost entirely built atop the foundation that is Originium.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Fighting over energy, the discrimination against the Infected, and the estrangement between war and races are all further tearing these lands apart...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We tried, but our efforts yielded very little... That's because we know practically nothing about Originium. We know nothing about this great land.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What happened to the sky and the ocean? Where did the ancient ruins come from? How exactly... were we born?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We hope you'll be able to find answers for us.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Surely, Kal'tsit must already have shared some of those with you.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: As for Originium, I'm sorry to say that the person I am now can't give you a good answer. At the very least, not an answer to everything.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: When I woke up, I tried to access the logs tracking Originium's progress, but strangely, there was nothing.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: And this glimpse of Terra that you showed me has made me even more confused.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: The development of Originium... has taken a completely different turn from what I expected. I need some time.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I need to explore and see this great land for myself, to understand how exactly Originium has influenced culture, life, and environment.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: This could take years, perhaps longer... And maybe, after an enormous amount of energy is expended, you will receive only a most disappointing answer.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I once made a promise to somebody. Thinking about it now, perhaps all I ever left myself or her... was regret.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: That's why I won't make a promise lightly, Kal'tsit. Forgive me...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: In that case, we will wait.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: No matter what your answer will be, Babel will last until the day of your return, Doctor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Thank you.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Well... sorry... but I'm a little hungry.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: PRTS showed me that the landship has a temporary cafeteria...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: That it does, but it might be a little messy there. How about I take you—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Thank you, Theresa, but no.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: This place has a special meaning to me, too. Let me walk there, slowly, by myself...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Okay... Be careful, Doctor.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The awakening has given the Doctor a lot of pressure, but it would seem this one is quick to adapt, and much quicker than I expected.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The Doctor wants to learn all there is to learn about Terra.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: A quick learner too, it seems.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: If the children were like the Doctor, perhaps they would have the chance to master even more languages and travel to so many places across Terra.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa, you should go back and look for the others. There should be plenty of Babel affairs that need the Chairman herself to...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Theresa?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal'tsit... there's something bothering me. Maybe I'm overthinking it, but I want to tell you.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Doctor seems to be very surprised by the look of Terra as it is today.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You once told me that nobody has a better understanding of Originium than the Doctor. The same Doctor who said that the development of Originium... took a completely different turn from the expected.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Then what should Originium have been like? What should these lands have been like?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...What should the Sarkaz have been like?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Is the Doctor ready to depart?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Right. The Doctor applied for a transport, some defensive weapons, and nothing else.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: The Doctor stated an intent to avoid combat zones.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Alright. We'll just abide the Doctor's wishes.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Your Highness, I would like to follow this Doctor of ours. Considering the background involved... I am worried.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Ascalon... have you ever left Kazdel?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Left? If we count how I once chased a quarry and left the area when I was small, then I most certainly have.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: That doesn't count.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Go, follow and protect the Doctor, but do not interfere.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I will keep a close eye—
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: No, Ascalon, calm down. I don't want you to keep an eye on anyone.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I want you to go out there and see how the people in other lands live. This is a great opportunity.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: How they live?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Outside our homeland, neither war nor suffering is part of people's daily lives. Food, fashion, arts, culture... We could have so much.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Many of us know this fact, but even more of us choose to ignore this fact, because most of the time we don't have the freedom to choose.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Don't give me that look, Ascalon. Listen to me.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: At first, you followed me because you opposed Theresis's measures, but what about after this division is over?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What will you do then? What will be the next stop for the countless Sarkaz who share the same idea as you?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: That's why you need to take a break from the war, and see the sights beyond our homeland.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: See the life that we should have lived.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: If that is your wish.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: It is!
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Have a safe trip.
attributes.name: Theresa
